result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle Joyce Zimmerman

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Amended Witness List

9:47 AM Defendant Danielle Joyce Zimmerman appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa Claire Goldman appeared by video for Danielle Joyce Zimmerman.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldman states the Clerk of Courts office failed to forward the appeal in case 18CV222 so she requests an additional 60 days. Matter set over. 
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
- Clerks Office states that the appeal was sent on June 22nd and has an appeal number.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:30AM Defendant Danielle Joyce Zimmerman appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa Claire Goldman appeared by video for Danielle Joyce Zimmerman.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. DE Atty Goldman filed two motions (document 26). DE motion to dismiss for modified Jury Instruction or continuance. Atty Goldman states the court should dismiss these charges due the DE not being properly served with the petition. Atty Goldman states the injunction hearing was invalid as the DE was not served the Petition. Atty Goldman states that she cannot be charged in this case if the injunction was invalid. ADA Kohl disagrees and states points from her motion. ADA Kohl states that the DE was aware of her injunction conditions prior to her making contact. The Court directs this matter be taken off the Jury calendar for further discussion of this case.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

4:06 PM Defendant Danielle Joyce Zimmerman appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa Claire Goldman appeared by video for Danielle Joyce Zimmerman.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Matter set to proceed to trial. PL has filed their witness lists. DE has not yet filed their witness lists. DE to file witness list by August 5th. No motions in limine have been filed. MIL to be filed by August 5th. An offer has been communicate to the DE from ADA Kohl. The DE did not accept the offer. Panel size: 36. Alternate: 1. Strikes: 4. Note taking allowed. ADA Kohl to file jury instructions by August 16th. Matter set over.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:16 PM Defendant Danielle Joyce Zimmerman appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa Claire Goldman appeared by video for Danielle Joyce Zimmerman.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The State has made a settlement offer, Defense is not accepting the offer at this time. Attorney Kohl requests new trial date. Matter set over.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:25 PM Danielle Joyce Zimmerman, defendant appeared in Court  with counsel Lisa Claire Goldman by video means.
Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.    Not Guilty plea entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
